name: Mike Lawson
descriptions: Mike Lawson is the head engineer at Hoover Dam in 2281.

Mike Lawson has been at Hoover Dam well before the first battle. When he first came to the dam, it only had one turbine spinning, but after the First Battle of Hoover Dam, he managed to get six of the eight turbines running, though two of them have ceased working.
Mike can be found on the bottom floor of Hoover Dam power plant 01.

topics.response_text: Eyebot Duraframe Subject E is both the prototype, and the last functional model in this test group.
Subject E: Diagnosis complete. Begin Recording.
Don't you see everything is going to hell? I'm gonna go find someplace safe to hide out at.

topics.topic_text: What can I do to help?
I can handle them, no problem.
Why do you call this place your baby?
topics.response_text: The power station, the dam, they're my babies. Well... don't tell my grandchildren I said that. Anything in here that I haven't rebuilt I've fixed.
Good luck. I'm going to find a place to not get shot.
I'm the head engineer. I make sure the turbines keep spinning and the water keeps pumping.

topics.topic_text: What do you think of Fantastic?
topics.response_text: Well{pause}he mostly stays out of the way, which is a good thing. He'd probably end up doing some real damage if he tried to make himself useful.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the last battle.
topics.response_text: I was down here for most of it, so I can't tell you much of what the boys with the guns were doing up top.
Good day to you, and stay out of trouble.

topics.topic_text: How is the dam running these days?
topics.response_text: Been better, been worse. When I first came here there was but one turbine spinning.

topics.topic_text: What is wrong with the other turbines?
topics.response_text: A little bit ago one of the intake towers got clogged. No water running through it anymore to spin the generators.
Good gracious! The Legion is using the intake tunnels to storm their way into the dam, someone has to stop them.
Please handle this information with the utmost care as it represents the sum total of the results of my research on the Duraframe Eyebots.
If you are listening to this log from one of our Enclave Outposts in Chicago, give this unit whatever repairs it needs so it can continue to Navarro.
